paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the structure and implications of TTR variants, particularly focusing on the V30M variant associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

patients.demographics: Patients from Portugal, Japan, Sweden, and other countries
patients.phenotype: Hereditary ATTR amyloidosis with varying onset of disease

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with an early age of onset usually suffer from peripheral polyneuropathy or involvement of autonomous nervous system and gut, whereas patients with a late onset suffer more often from amyloid cardiomyopathy.
Patients with a late onset suffer more often from amyloid cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant leads to a more prone dissociation of the TTR tetramer, resulting in earlier onset of disease.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The paper emphasizes the structural similarities between wild type and V30M variants.
key_quotes: A common point mutation is V30M that causes hotspots of hereditary ATTR amyloidosis in Portugal, Japan, Sweden, and other countries.
Symptoms of hereditary ATTRV30M amyloidosis can start with varying onset of disease.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant data was clearly presented in the text.
